alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Los Angeles County Beaches; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Malibu Coast; Palos Verdes Hills; Santa Susana Mountains; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Western San Fernando Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 4:17PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A line of strong showers and isolated thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Ventura and central Los Angeles Counties through 500 PM PDT... At 414 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong showers and isolated thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from Studio City to 7 miles north of Two Harbors. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could down trees, tree limbs, and power lines, and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Monica...Pacific Palisades...Venice Beach...Long Beach... Encino...Inglewood...Rancho Palos Verdes...Van Nuys...Culver City... Torrance...Whittier...Burbank...Beverly Hills...Northridge... Woodland Hills...Downtown Los Angeles...Pasadena...Chatsworth... and Manhattan Beach. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in OXNARD.
